chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Your Response:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

Your Response:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
None

Goal:
forall (X : Type) (f : X -> X), FiniteT X -> injective f -> surjective f

Premises:
Inductive GFormula (TA TX AA AF : Type) : Type := TT : Tauto.GFormula | FF : Tauto.GFormula | X : TX -> Tauto.GFormula | A : TA -> AA -> Tauto.GFormula | Cj : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | D : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | N : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | I : Tauto.GFormula -> option AF -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula Arguments Tauto.GFormula {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.TT {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.FF {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.X {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.A {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.Cj {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.D {TA TX AA AF}%
injective = fun (U V : Type) (f : U -> V) => forall x y : U, f x = f y -> x = y : forall U V : Type, (U -> V) -> Prop Arguments injective {U V}%type_scope _%function_scope
Inductive FiniteT : Type -> Prop := empty_finite : FiniteT False | add_finite : forall T : Type, FiniteT T -> FiniteT (option T) | bij_finite : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y), FiniteT X -> invertible f -> FiniteT Y Arguments FiniteT _%type_scope Arguments add_finite _%type_scope Arguments bij_finite (_ _)%type_scope _%function_scope
surjective = fun (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) => forall y : Y, exists x : X, f x = y : forall X Y : Type, (X -> Y) -> Prop Arguments surjective {X Y}%type_scope _%function_scope
bijective = fun (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) => injective f /\ surjective f : forall X Y : Type, (X -> Y) -> Prop Arguments bijective {X Y}%type_scope _%function_scope
surj_finite : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y), FiniteT X -> surjective f -> (forall y1 y2 : Y, y1 = y2 \/ y1 <> y2) -> FiniteT Y
inj_finite : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y), FiniteT Y -> injective f -> (forall y : Y, (exists x : X, f x = y) \/ ~ (exists x : X, f x = y)) -> FiniteT X
bij_finite : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y), FiniteT X -> invertible f -> FiniteT Y
Inductive FiniteT : Type -> Prop := empty_finite : FiniteT False | add_finite : forall T : Type, FiniteT T -> FiniteT (option T) | bij_finite : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y), FiniteT X -> invertible f -> FiniteT Y Arguments FiniteT _%type_scope Arguments add_finite _%type_scope Arguments bij_finite (_ _)%type_scope _%function_scope
Im_intro : forall (U V : Type) (X : Ensemble U) (f : U -> V) (x : U), In X x -> forall y : V, y = f x -> In (Im X f) y
FiniteT_img : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y), FiniteT X -> (forall y1 y2 : Y, y1 = y2 \/ y1 <> y2) -> Finite Y (Im Full_set f)
Im_add : forall (X : Ensemble ?U) (x : ?U) (f : ?U -> ?V), Im (Add X x) f = Add (Im X f) (f x) where ?U : [ |- Type] ?V : [ |- Type]
Inductive invertible (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) : Prop := intro_invertible : forall g : Y -> X, (forall x : X, g (f x) = x) -> (forall y : Y, f (g y) = y) -> invertible f Arguments invertible {X Y}%type_scope _%function_scope Arguments intro_invertible {X Y}%type_scope (_ _ _ _)%function_scope
finite_subtype : forall (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop), FiniteT X -> (forall x : X, P x \/ ~ P x) -> FiniteT {x : X | P x}
Im_inv : forall (X : Ensemble ?U) (f : ?U -> ?V) (y : ?V), In (Im X f) y -> exists x : ?U, In X x /\ f x = y where ?U : [ |- Type] ?V : [ |- Type]
Inductive Im (U V : Type) (X : Ensemble U) (f : U -> V) : Ensemble V := Im_intro : forall x : U, In X x -> forall y : V, y = f x -> In (Im X f) y Arguments Im {U V}%type_scope _ _%function_scope Arguments Im_intro (_ _)%type_scope _ _%function_scope
FiniteT_sind : forall P : Type -> SProp, P False -> (forall T : Type, FiniteT T -> P T -> P (option T)) -> (forall (X Y : Type) (f1 : X -> Y), FiniteT X -> P X -> invertible f1 -> P Y) -> forall T : Type, FiniteT T -> P T
FiniteT_ind : forall P : Type -> Prop, P False -> (forall T : Type, FiniteT T -> P T -> P (option T)) -> (forall (X Y : Type) (f1 : X -> Y), FiniteT X -> P X -> invertible f1 -> P Y) -> forall T : Type, FiniteT T -> P T
finite_dec_exists : forall (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop), FiniteT X -> (forall x : X, {P x} + {~ P x}) -> {exists x : X, P x} + {forall x : X, ~ P x}
finite_dec_forall : forall (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop), FiniteT X -> (forall x : X, {P x} + {~ P x}) -> {forall x : X, P x} + {exists x : X, ~ P x}
In_Image_elim : forall (A : Ensemble ?U) (f : ?U -> ?V), injective f -> forall x : ?U, In (Im A f) (f x) -> In A x where ?U : [ |- Type] ?V : [ |- Type]
BinInt.Z.min_mono : forall f : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq eq) f -> Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful BinInt.Z.le BinInt.Z.le) f -> forall x y : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.min (f x) (f y) = f (BinInt.Z.min x y)
finite_choice : forall (A B : Type) (R : A -> B -> Prop), FiniteT A -> (forall x : A, exists y : B, R x y) -> exists f : A -> B, forall x : A, R x (f x)
not_injective_elim : forall f : ?U -> ?V, ~ injective f -> exists x y : ?U, f x = f y /\ x <> y where ?U : [ |- Type] ?V : [ |- Type]
cardinal_unicity : forall (U : Type) (X : Ensemble U) (n : nat), cardinal U X n -> forall m : nat, cardinal U X m -> n = m
injective_preserves_cardinal : forall (A : Ensemble ?U) (f : ?U -> ?V) (n : nat), injective f -> cardinal ?U A n -> forall n' : nat, cardinal ?V (Im A f) n' -> n' = n where ?U : [ |- Type] ?V : [ |- Type]
Pigeonhole : forall (A : Ensemble ?U) (f : ?U -> ?V) (n : nat), cardinal ?U A n -> forall n' : nat, cardinal ?V (Im A f) n' -> n' < n -> ~ injective f where ?U : [ |- Type] ?V : [ |- Type]
finite_dep_choice : forall (A : Type) (B : A -> Type) (R : forall x : A, B x -> Prop), FiniteT A -> (forall x : A, exists y : B x, R x y) -> exists f : forall x : A, B x, forall x : A, R x (f x)
finite_eq_dec : forall X : Type, FiniteT X -> forall x y : X, {x = y} + {x <> y}
intro_invertible : forall (f : ?X -> ?Y) (g : ?Y -> ?X), (forall x : ?X, g (f x) = x) -> (forall y : ?Y, f (g y) = y) -> invertible f where ?X : [ |- Type] ?Y : [ |- Type]
ChoiceFacts.OmniscientFunctionalChoice_on = fun A B : Type => forall R : A -> B -> Prop, inhabited B -> exists f : A -> B, forall x : A, (exists y : B, R x y) -> R x (f x) : Type -> Type -> Prop Arguments ChoiceFacts.OmniscientFunctionalChoice_on (_ _)%type_scope
ChoiceFacts.FunctionalChoice_on = fun A B : Type => forall R : A -> B -> Prop, (forall x : A, exists y : B, R x y) -> exists f : A -> B, forall x : A, R x (f x) : Type -> Type -> Prop Arguments ChoiceFacts.FunctionalChoice_on (_ _)%type_scope
image_empty : forall f : ?U -> ?V, Im Empty_set f = Empty_set where ?U : [ |- Type] ?V : [ |- Type]
Empty_set_minimal : forall (U : Type) (X : Ensemble U), Included Empty_set X

```coq
From Coq Require Import FiniteType.

Proof.
  intros X f FT XF.
  split.
  - apply inj_finite; eauto.
    intros y H.
    destruct (surj_finite X Y f FT XF y) as [x Hx].
    exists x; split; eauto.
    apply Im_intro; eauto.
  - apply surj_finite; eauto.
    intros y1 y2 H.
    destruct (finite_eq_dec X FT y1 y2) as [Heq|Hneq].
    + subst y2; eauto.
    + apply not_injective_elim in Hneq; eauto.
      destruct Hneq as [x1 [x2 Hx]].
      apply not_injective_elim in Hx; eauto.
      destruct Hx as [y1 [y2 Hx]].
      apply not_injective_elim in Hx; eauto.
      destruct Hx as [x [Hx Hx']].
      apply not_injective_elim in Hx; eauto.
      destruct Hx as [y [Hy Hx]].
      elimtype False; eauto.
Qed.
